responsibilities: Contribute to and drive an ambitious, high-impact research agenda in principled machine-learning methodologies for Quantum Chemistry.
Develop and test out new ideas within existing or new collaborations.
Write research code to implement and test new approaches.
Develop novel theoretical and practical insights.
Prepare technical papers, presentations, and open-source releases of research code.
skills: Ability to develop and test new ideas in a collaborative environment.
Strong understanding of state-of-the-art quantum chemistry methods.
Effective communication of technical concepts to non-experts from different technical backgrounds.
analysis:
The job responsibilities focus on contributing to research in machine-learning methodologies specifically for Quantum Chemistry. The tasks include developing and testing new ideas, writing research code, and preparing technical papers and presentations. The skills required include proficiency in writing research code, understanding quantum chemistry methods, and effective communication of technical concepts.

There is no explicit mention of Generative AI or language models (LLMs) in the responsibilities or skills. The focus is on machine-learning methodologies for Quantum Chemistry, which may or may not involve GenAI or LLMs. The job seems to be more centered around the application of machine learning to quantum chemistry rather than specifically working with GenAI or LLMs.
